Requirement / Description: Shall divide master clock to produce Phi1 Phi2 at 375 kHz
Phi1 and Phi2 shall be non-overlapping
Shall count 20 bit times per word (T0-T19)
Shall alternate between WA and WO word types
Shall generate word_mark at T18 of every word
Shall generate frame_mark at end of OP 511
Reset shall clear all counters and start from T0/WA/OP0
Shall instantiate and interconnect all 7 modules
Shall complete one frame in <= 60 ms
All inter-module data paths shall be 20 bits wide
Shall support multiple PMU instances for parallel computation
Shall provide system reset that initializes all modules
External I/O timing shall be compatible with sensor/actuator specs
FPGA resource utilization shall be documented
Shall use Booth's algorithm for partial product generation
Shall produce a 20-bit result from upper bits of 40-bit product
Shall correctly handle multiplication by zero
Shall correctly handle multiplication by +1 (0x3FFFF in fractional)
Shall correctly handle the most negative x most negative case
Shall pulse done for exactly one clock cycle when result is valid
Shall complete multiplication within 20 clock cycles (one word time)
Result shall be rounded to nearest (round half up)
Shall produce both quotient and remainder
Shall handle division of zero dividend correctly (result = 0)
Shall correctly handle negative dividend and positive divisor
Shall correctly handle positive dividend and negative divisor
Shall correctly handle negative dividend and negative divisor
Shall pulse done for exactly one clock cycle when result valid
Shall complete division within 22 clock cycles
Quotient shall satisfy: dividend = quotient x divisor + remainder
Shall implement all 16 ALU operations per the opcode table
Shall generate Z N C flags from ALU result
ACC shall only update when acc_write_en is asserted
TMP shall only update when tmp_write_en is asserted
Flags shall only update when flags_write_en is asserted
ADD/SUB shall operate on signed 2s complement fractional numbers
SHR shall perform arithmetic right shift (sign extension)
SHL shall perform arithmetic left shift (sign bit preserved)
Gray-to-Binary conversion shall be correct for all 20-bit patterns
Binary-to-Gray conversion shall be correct for all 20-bit patterns
ABS of most negative number (0x80000) shall saturate to 0x7FFFF
All ALU operations shall be single-cycle (combinational result)
alu_result output shall be purely combinational
Reset shall clear ACC TMP and all flags to zero
Shall provide 20-bit wide random access storage
Shall support at least 64 addressable locations
Shall support simultaneous read and write to different addresses
Write shall occur on rising clock edge when write_en is asserted
Read shall be asynchronous (combinational) or synchronous with 1-cycle latency
Read-during-write to same address: new data forwarded (write-first)
Reset shall clear all locations to zero
Data shall be retained between clock cycles when not written
FPGA implementation should map to Block RAM or distributed RAM
Address out of range shall have defined behavior (wrap or read zero)
Shall be purely combinational (no clock no registers)
Shall route one of 8 sources to ACC input per sel_acc_src
Shall route one of 4 sources to RAS write data per sel_ras_src
Shall route one of 4 sources to I/O output per sel_io_src
All three output muxes shall operate independently
Same source may be routed to multiple destinations simultaneously
Maximum propagation delay shall not exceed critical path budget
Reserved select values shall output zero
All 20 bits shall be routed (no bit swapping or modification)
Shall store the complete CADC microprogram
Shall implement a micro-PC with sequential increment
Shall implement conditional branch on Z N C flags
Shall decode microinstruction fields to individual control signals
Micro-PC shall reset to 0 on rst or frame_mark
Data ROM shall provide constants to data path via SL
Control ROM should be loadable (Block RAM) for program updates
Shall support subroutine call/return with stack
Stack depth shall be at least 4 levels
All control outputs shall be registered (synchronous)
Branch-on-busy shall allow PMU/PDU to complete before proceeding
Shall read sensor data when commanded by IOCTL
Shall write to display/actuator outputs when commanded by IOCTL
Sensor read shall latch input data and present on io_data_out
Output writes shall latch data into holding registers
Output holding registers shall drive external signals continuously
NOP IOCTL shall not change any I/O state
Reset shall clear all output holding registers to zero
Gray-coded sensor inputs shall be passed as-is (conversion in SLF)
Output shall only drive when channel_active = 1
fail_detect shall assert on detected self-test failure
I/O operation shall complete in a single clock cycle
io_ready shall assert when read data is valid or write is latched
Single bit set in each position
Criteria / Expected: Verify each bit position contributes correctly
busy goes high on start and goes low when done
done is high for exactly 1 clock cycle
New start during busy shall be ignored or restart
Can start new multiply immediately after done
rst during multiplication clears state and deasserts busy
div_by_zero asserted; done asserted; quotient undefined

Requirement / Description: Verify remainder for all basic tests

Criteria / Expected: Exercise both add and subtract paths
busy goes high on start and low when done
Start new divide immediately after done
ACC unchanged after ALU op with acc_write_en=0

Requirement / Description: Write to address 0 and read back
Write to max address (63) and read back
Write all ones (0xFFFFF) and read back
Write alternating pattern and read back
Write different data to adjacent addresses
Criteria / Expected: Each address returns its own data
All values retained and independently readable
Verify every address reads 0 after reset

Requirement / Description: Write enabled for one cycle only
All three muxes select different sources
Criteria / Expected: Each output reflects its selected source

Requirement / Description: All three muxes select same source
Branch on PMU busy not taken

Criteria / Expected: Address and enables match RASCTL field
SL select signals match SL_ACC and SL_RAS fields
Instructions execute on correct word boundaries
Latched value reflects time of read
out_mach = written value; held until next write
Writing to one channel doesn't affect others
Only targeted input appears on io_data_out
Load ACC; add value; verify result
Load PMU operands via SL; start PMU; wait; read result
Load PDU operands; start PDU; wait; read quotient
Write ACC to RAS; read back; compare
Read sensor via I/O Bridge; route to ACC
Compute result; route to display output
Run all 512 OPs; verify frame_mark generation
Known Ps value -> Correct altitude on display
Known Qc and Ps -> Mach 0 on display
Known Qc Ps TAT -> Correct airspeed
Active channel fails; backup takes over
